org.platanios.learn.math.matrix

Class HashVector

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.platanios.learn.math.matrix.Vector
      • org.platanios.learn.math.matrix.HashVector

  • public class HashVector
extends Vector
    Implements a class representing sparse vectors and supporting operations related to them. The sparse vectors are stored in an internal hash map. TODO: Add toDenseVector() method (or appropriate constructors). TODO: Make this implementation faster by iterating over key-value pairs instead of iterating over keys and then retrieving values. TODO: Add Builder class and remove constructors.
    Author:
    Emmanouil Antonios Platanios

      Computes the square root of the sum of the squares of each pair of vector elements (that is equivalent to computing length of the hypotenuse of a right triangle given the lengths of the other two sides) without having an underflow or an overflow.

      Computes the square root of the sum of the squares of each pair of vector elements (that is equivalent to computing length of the hypotenuse of a right triangle given the lengths of the other two sides) without avoiding an underflow or an overflow.

      Computes the square root of the sum of the squares of each pair of vector elements (that is equivalent to computing length of the hypotenuse of a right triangle given the lengths of the other two sides) without having an underflow or an overflow.

      Computes the inner product (also known as the dot product) between the current vector and another vector.

      Computes the result of applying the supplied function element-wise to the current vector and adding the provided vector to the result, and replaces the current vector with the result.

      Computes the result of applying the supplied function element-wise to the current vector and the provided vector (the elements of the two vectors with the same index are considered in pairs) and returns it in a new vector.

      Computes the result of applying the supplied function element-wise to the current vector and the provided vector (the elements of the two vectors with the same index are considered in pairs) and replaces the current vector with the result.

      • HashVector

        protected HashVector(java.io.ObjectInputStream inputStream)
              throws java.io.IOException
        Constructs a sparse vector from the contents of the provided input stream. Note that the contents of the stream must have been written using the writeToStream(java.io.ObjectOutputStream) function of this class in order to be compatible with this constructor. If the contents are not compatible, then an IOException might be thrown, or the constructed vector might be corrupted in some way.
        Parameters:
        inputStream - The input stream to read the contents of this vector from.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • saxpy

        public HashVector saxpy(double scalar,
                        Vector vector)
        Performs the saxpy operation, as it is named in LAPACK. Let us denote the current vector by \(\boldsymbol{y}\). Given a scalar \(\alpha\) and another vector \(\boldsymbol{x}\), this function returns the value of \(\boldsymbol{y}+\alpha\boldsymbol{x}\).
        Specified by:
        saxpy in class Vector
        Parameters:
        scalar - The scalar \(\alpha\).
        vector - The vector \(\boldsymbol{x}\).
        Returns:
        The value of \(\boldsymbol{y}+\alpha\boldsymbol{x}\).

      • saxpyInPlace

        public HashVector saxpyInPlace(double scalar,
                               Vector vector)
        Performs the saxpy operation, as it is named in LAPACK, in-place. Let us denote the current vector by \(\boldsymbol{y}\). Given a scalar \(\alpha\) and another vector \(\boldsymbol{x}\), this function replaces this vector with the value of \(\boldsymbol{y}+\alpha\boldsymbol{x}\) and returns it.
        Specified by:
        saxpyInPlace in class Vector
        Parameters:
        scalar - The scalar \(\alpha\).
        vector - The vector \(\boldsymbol{x}\).
        Returns:
        The value of \(\boldsymbol{y}+\alpha\boldsymbol{x}\).

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • hypotenuse

        public HashVector hypotenuse(Vector vector)
        Computes the square root of the sum of the squares of each pair of vector elements (that is equivalent to computing length of the hypotenuse of a right triangle given the lengths of the other two sides) without having an underflow or an overflow. Denoting the two vectors by \(\boldsymbol{a}\) (the current vector) and \(\boldsymbol{b}\) (the provided vector), respectively, this function computes the quantity: \[c_i=\sqrt{a_i^2+b_i^2},\] where \(\boldsymbol{c}\) is the resulting vector. The result is returned in a new vector. This method is slower than Vector.hypotenuseFast(Vector), but it tries to avoid numerical precision errors, while Vector.hypotenuseFast(Vector) does not.
        Specified by:
        hypotenuse in class Vector
        Parameters:
        vector - The vector to use as vector \(\boldsymbol{b}\) in the above equation.
        Returns:
        A new vector holding the result of this operation.

      • hypotenuseInPlace

        public HashVector hypotenuseInPlace(Vector vector)
        Computes the square root of the sum of the squares of each pair of vector elements (that is equivalent to computing length of the hypotenuse of a right triangle given the lengths of the other two sides) without having an underflow or an overflow. Denoting the two vectors by \(\boldsymbol{a}\) (the current vector) and \(\boldsymbol{b}\) (the provided vector), respectively, this function computes the quantity: \[c_i=\sqrt{a_i^2+b_i^2},\] where \(\boldsymbol{c}\) is the resulting vector. The current vector is replaced with the result. This method is slower than Vector.hypotenuseFastInPlace(Vector), but it tries to avoid numerical precision errors, while Vector.hypotenuseFastInPlace(Vector) does not.
        Specified by:
        hypotenuseInPlace in class Vector
        Parameters:
        vector - The vector to use as vector \(\boldsymbol{b}\) in the above equation.
        Returns:
        The current vector holding the result of this operation.

      • hypotenuseFast

        public HashVector hypotenuseFast(Vector vector)
        Computes the square root of the sum of the squares of each pair of vector elements (that is equivalent to computing length of the hypotenuse of a right triangle given the lengths of the other two sides) without avoiding an underflow or an overflow. Denoting the two vectors by \(\boldsymbol{a}\) (the current vector) and \(\boldsymbol{b}\) (the provided vector), respectively, this function computes the quantity: \[c_i=\sqrt{a_i^2+b_i^2},\] where \(\boldsymbol{c}\) is the resulting vector. The result is returned in a new vector. This method is faster than Vector.hypotenuse(Vector), but it does not try to avoid numerical precision errors, while Vector.hypotenuse(Vector) does try to avoid such errors.
        Specified by:
        hypotenuseFast in class Vector
        Parameters:
        vector - The vector to use as vector \(\boldsymbol{b}\) in the above equation.
        Returns:
        A new vector holding the result of this operation.

      • hypotenuseFastInPlace

        public HashVector hypotenuseFastInPlace(Vector vector)
        Computes the square root of the sum of the squares of each pair of vector elements (that is equivalent to computing length of the hypotenuse of a right triangle given the lengths of the other two sides) without avoiding an underflow or an overflow. Denoting the two vectors by \(\boldsymbol{a}\) (the current vector) and \(\boldsymbol{b}\) (the provided vector), respectively, this function computes the quantity: \[c_i=\sqrt{a_i^2+b_i^2},\] where \(\boldsymbol{c}\) is the resulting vector. The current vector is replaced with the result. This method is faster than Vector.hypotenuseInPlace(Vector), but it does not try to avoid numerical precision errors, while Vector.hypotenuseInPlace(Vector) does try to avoid such errors.
        Specified by:
        hypotenuseFastInPlace in class Vector
        Parameters:
        vector - The vector to use as vector \(\boldsymbol{b}\) in the above equation.
        Returns:
        A new vector holding the result of this operation.

        public HashVector mapInPlace(java.util.function.Function<java.lang.Double,java.lang.Double> function)
        Computes the result of applying the supplied function element-wise to the current vector and replaces the current vector with the result.
        Specified by:
        mapInPlace in class Vector
        Parameters:

      • gaxpy

        public Vector gaxpy(Matrix matrix,
                    Vector vector)
        Performs the gaxpy operation, as it is named in LAPACK. Let us denote the current vector by \(\boldsymbol{y}\). Given a matrix \(\A\) and another vector \(\boldsymbol{x}\), this function returns the value of \(\boldsymbol{y}+A\boldsymbol{x}\).
        Specified by:
        gaxpy in class Vector
        Parameters:
        matrix - The matrix \(\A\).
        vector - The vector \(\boldsymbol{x}\).
        Returns:
        The value of \(\boldsymbol{y}+A\boldsymbol{x}\).

      • gaxpyInPlace

        public Vector gaxpyInPlace(Matrix matrix,
                           Vector vector)
        Performs the gaxpy operation, as it is named in LAPACK, in-place. Let us denote the current vector by \(\boldsymbol{y}\). Given a matrix \(A\) and another vector \(\boldsymbol{x}\), this function replaces this vector with the value of \(\boldsymbol{y}+A\boldsymbol{x}\) and returns it.
        Specified by:
        gaxpyInPlace in class Vector
        Parameters:
        matrix - The matrix \(A\).
        vector - The vector \(\boldsymbol{x}\).
        Returns:
        The value of \(\boldsymbol{y}+A\boldsymbol{x}\).

      • transMult

        public Vector transMult(Matrix matrix)
        Let us denote the current vector by \(\boldsymbol{y}\). Given a matrix \(\A\), this function returns the value of \(\boldsymbol{y}^{\top}A\).
        Specified by:
        transMult in class Vector
        Parameters:
        matrix - The matrix \(A\).
        Returns:
        The value of \(\boldsymbol{y}^{\top}A\).

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object object)
        Compares the current vector with another object for equality. Note that if the provided object is not a vector object, then this method returns false. Otherwise, it checks for equality of the element values of the two vectors, with some tolerance that is equal to the square root of the smallest possible value that can be represented by a double precision floating point number. That tolerance is used because double precision floating point number values are compared.
        Specified by:
        equals in class Vector
        Parameters:
        object - The object with which to compare this vector.
        Returns:
        True if this vector is equal to the provided object and false if it is not.
